snippet: Designed to illustrate the influence of Chinese culture on Western fashion, this Metropolitan Museum of Art show, organized by a Costume Institute curator, is one of the museum’s largest ever.
abstract: Holland Cotter reviews exhibit China: Through the Looking Glass, exploring influence of Chinese culture on Western fashion, at Metropolitan Museum of Art.
lead_paragraph: Designed to illustrate the influence of Chinese culture on Western fashion, this Metropolitan Museum of Art show, organized by a Costume Institute curator, is one of the museum’s largest ever.

headline.main: Review: In ‘China: Through the Looking Glass,’ Eastern Culture Meets Western Fashion
headline.print_headline: West Meets East, and Wears It Well
